userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: [Identification of item], James Monroe Paper, WLU Coll 0017, Special Collections, Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA.
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections' staff to verify the appropriate format.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Monroe was the Governor of Virginia, 1799-1802, 1811.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes the appointment, July 29, 1800, of John Bowyer, Andrew Reid, and John Caruthers as presidential electors; proclamation, March 16, 1802, by Gov. Monroe authorizing the meeting house outside Lexington, Va. as a proper place for holding court (2 copies); and U.S. land grant of 160 acres, April 2, 1818, to Aaron Sanford. All of these documents are signed by Monroe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This document commissions Bowyer, Caruthers, and Reid as Electors for the County of Rockbridge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This document proclaims that the Courts will use the local meeting house following the destruction of the Courthouse of the County of Rockbridge by fire.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This document proclaims that the Courts will use the local meeting house following the destruction of the Courthouse of the County of Rockbridge by fire.
